Labels.DeleteItems: Are you sure you want to delete the selected {count, plural, one {item} other {items}}?

ErrorMessages.NoParts: No flow parts specific, you must have some parts to save a flow
ErrorMessages.NoInput: No input node specific, each flow needs one input node
ErrorMessages.TooManyInputNodes: You can only have one input node

Fields.Extensions-Help: A list of extensions that if match will output to the first output node, otherwise the second output node will be used.

ErrorMessages.LogFailed: Failed to retrieve log for worker

Messages.CancelMesssage: Are you sure you want to cancel the worker for {CurrentFile}?
Messages.Waiting: Waiting for a file to process

Messages.Cancel: Are you sure you want to cancel and discard all changes?

ErrorMessages.NoFlows:
There are no flows configured.
Create a flow before adding or updating a library.

Fields.Name: Name
Fields.Filter-Help:
An optional filter regular expression to run against matching files.
Example: \.(mp4|mkv|avi|mpg|mov)$

Fields.Source-Help: The source directory containing the video files to convert.  This will be recursively searched.
Fields.Destination-Help:
The destination directory where the encode files will be placed.
Note: If blank, the files will be saved in the same directory as the source files and the source files will be replaced.
Fields.Container-Help: The container converted videos will be created with.
Fields.TestMode-Help: When in test mode no actual encoding will be done, only the results of what would happen are shown.
Fields.Extensions-Help: A list of file extensions to be considered a video file

Fields.HandBrakeCli-Help: The full location of the handbrakecli.exe.  HandBrakeCLI is used to encode the videos.
Fields.FFProbeExe-Help: The full location of the ffprobe.exe executable.  This is needed to scan the current videos to see if they need reencoding.
